data:
1
00:00:16,081 --> 00:00:20,582
The Crow (2014)
- <font color="#D81D1D">Subtitle By (NaShWaN AL-YeMeN 2021)</font> -

2
00:00:23,482 --> 00:00:28,160
October 30th - Devil's Night

3
00:00:45,814 --> 00:00:49,234
People once believed
that when someone dies...

4
00:00:49,313 --> 00:00:53,613
a crow carries their soul
to the land of the dead.

5
00:00:53,694 --> 00:00:57,034
But sometimes,
something so bad happens...

6
00:00:57,114 --> 00:01:02,364
that a terrible sadness is carried
with it and the soul can't rest.

7
00:01:02,454 --> 00:01:05,494
Then sometimes,
just sometimes...

8
00:01:05,584 --> 00:01:10,584
the crow can bring that soul back
to put the wrong things right.

9
00:01:53,675 --> 00:01:56,175
Over here.

10
00:01:56,255 --> 00:02:00,265
There's a piece of glass.

11
00:02:00,345 --> 00:02:02,476
Hey, Sarge!

12
00:02:02,515 --> 00:02:04,765
Yeah?

13
00:02:04,846 --> 00:02:09,356
Shelly Webster and Eric Draven.
Wedding was tomorrow night.

14
00:02:09,436 --> 00:02:12,685
Who the fuck gets married
on Halloween anyhow?

15
00:02:12,776 --> 00:02:14,695
Nobody.

16
00:02:16,275 --> 00:02:20,236
- Sir, we gotta move her.
- Do it.

17
00:02:20,325 --> 00:02:22,575
All right, guys,
let's do it.

18
00:02:22,656 --> 00:02:25,866
Devil's fucking Night.
What's the count so far?

19
00:02:25,956 --> 00:02:27,326
143 fires.

20
00:02:27,376 --> 00:02:30,206
- They're slacking off from last year.
- Three hours to go.

21
00:02:30,296 --> 00:02:35,176
- Maybe they're just slow starters.
- Coming through!

22
00:02:38,136 --> 00:02:41,467
You guys can't come in here
and take her away like this.

23
00:02:41,556 --> 00:02:46,347
There are procedures. You should have
cleared this with me first.

24
00:02:46,436 --> 00:02:48,726
- Is this the victim?
- No, it's Amelia Earhart.

25
00:02:48,767 --> 00:02:51,647
- We found her, and you missed it.
- I don't care what her name is.

26
00:02:51,726 --> 00:02:54,316
I didn't give the order to move her.
Jesus, Albrecht.

27
00:02:54,397 --> 00:02:57,856
I can see why they took away
your gold shield.

28
00:02:57,947 --> 00:03:00,947
Yeah, I wasn't a big enough asshole.
Come on. Let's go.

29
00:03:01,026 --> 00:03:02,947
All right, clear out.

30
00:03:04,327 --> 00:03:06,917
- Shelly?
- Stand back, kid.

31
00:03:09,167 --> 00:03:13,377
- Where's Eric?
- Just don't worry about him.

32
00:03:13,457 --> 00:03:15,667
Tell him to take care
of Sarah.

33
00:03:15,757 --> 00:03:19,678
Look, I will.
You just, uh, lie back. Come on.

34
00:03:29,688 --> 00:03:32,518
- You Sarah?
- Yeah.

35
00:03:32,608 --> 00:03:36,647
Yeah, look. Your sister,
she's gonna be okay.

36
00:03:36,697 --> 00:03:39,988
She's not my sister.
Shelly just takes care of me.

37
00:03:40,028 --> 00:03:42,368
She's my friend.

38
00:03:42,448 --> 00:03:46,368
Her and Eric.

39
00:03:46,408 --> 00:03:48,668
You lied to her about Eric.

40
00:03:48,748 --> 00:03:50,328
I had to.

41
00:03:50,418 --> 00:03:54,128
And you're lying
to me about Shelly.

42
00:03:54,208 --> 00:03:56,548
She's gonna die,
isn't she?

43
00:03:56,588 --> 00:04:01,218
Hey, uh...

44
00:04:05,599 --> 00:04:11,309
Now, come on.
Come on. It's okay.

45
00:04:11,438 --> 00:04:14,858
She's gonna be fine.

46
00:04:33,749 --> 00:04:37,799
A building gets torch ed.
All that is left is ashes.

47
00:04:37,879 --> 00:04:40,759
I used to think that was true
about everything...

48
00:04:40,839 --> 00:04:45,259
families, friends, feelings.

49
00:04:45,309 --> 00:04:49,270
But now I know that sometimes,
if love proves real...

50
00:04:49,309 --> 00:04:53,690
two people who are meant to be together,
nothing can keep them apart.

51
00:05:19,510 --> 00:05:22,510
Later.

52
00:05:31,940 --> 00:05:35,151
What are you,
like the night watchman?

53
00:05:56,461 --> 00:05:59,841
You know, what this place
needs is a...

54
00:05:59,921 --> 00:06:02,261
good natural catastrophe.

55
00:06:02,341 --> 00:06:06,761
- Earthquake, tornado, you know.
- No, no, no, no.

56
00:06:06,801 --> 00:06:09,811
Mickey, come on, man. You got to put
the mustard underneath first.

57
00:06:09,892 --> 00:06:12,182
Maybe a flood like in the Bible.

58
00:06:12,271 --> 00:06:15,312
Hey, hey, let me do it.

59
00:06:15,402 --> 00:06:19,442
There we go. All right.
How about some onions?

60
00:06:19,482 --> 00:06:21,942
Come on, man.
Don't cheap out on me.

61
00:06:21,992 --> 00:06:23,952
- Lots of onions.
- All right, here you go.

62
00:06:23,992 --> 00:06:26,412
Hey, all right.

63
00:06:26,492 --> 00:06:28,872
Now we're talking.

64
00:06:28,952 --> 00:06:33,662
Hey, it's the Sarah monster.

65
00:06:33,752 --> 00:06:37,583
- How do you steer that on a wet street?
- Pure talent. Hi.

66
00:06:37,672 --> 00:06:41,592
Now, Sarah, she's a genuine hot dogger.
You hungry?

67
00:06:41,672 --> 00:06:43,472
- You buying?
- I'm buying.

68
00:06:43,552 --> 00:06:47,223
- No onions though, okay?
- No onions?

69
00:06:47,302 --> 00:06:50,513
They make you fart big time.

70
00:06:56,852 --> 00:06:59,562
You know, Lake Erie
actually caught on fire once...

71
00:06:59,653 --> 00:07:02,283
from all the crap
floating around in it.

72
00:07:03,442 --> 00:07:07,203
I wish I could have seen that.

73
00:08:07,514 --> 00:08:12,015
Fire it up! Yeah!

74
00:08:51,135 --> 00:08:55,065
- All right, we busted their machines!
- Shit!

75
00:09:18,046 --> 00:09:21,416
Oh, oh, shit, guys.
T- bird, cop car, cop car.

76
00:09:28,677 --> 00:09:31,267
Bad people out
on the street tonight.

77
00:09:37,317 --> 00:09:39,227
- Damn it!
- What was that?

78
00:09:39,317 --> 00:09:41,987
- You wait right here.
- Be careful.

79
00:09:42,067 --> 00:09:45,367
Mickey, call it in for me!

80
00:11:05,989 --> 00:11:09,069
Gabriel!

81
00:11:19,289 --> 00:11:22,380
- Eric?
- Department of Housing!

82
00:11:22,459 --> 00:11:26,970
Code violations?
Safety hazards?

83
00:11:27,049 --> 00:11:29,260
Place looks fine to me.

84
00:11:29,299 --> 00:11:32,140
Let's redecorate.

85
00:11:34,639 --> 00:11:38,810
"Abash, the devil stood...

86
00:11:38,850 --> 00:11:41,560
and felt how awful
goodness is.

87
00:11:41,650 --> 00:11:46,240
Saw virtue in her shape, how lovely. "
It's pornography.

88
00:11:47,360 --> 00:11:51,240
Virtue?

89
00:11:51,320 --> 00:11:54,290
Shelly?

90
00:11:56,250 --> 00:11:59,330
- No! Eric!
- See ya!

91
00:11:59,370 --> 00:12:02,130
No, no, no, me first.

92
00:12:04,171 --> 00:12:06,421
Please.

93
00:12:08,051 --> 00:12:10,591
- Shelly.
- Eric!

94
00:12:49,931 --> 00:12:52,841
- Hey, that's good.
- That's good.

95
00:12:56,721 --> 00:13:00,311
See if you can top that, man.
Can you top that?

96
00:13:00,392 --> 00:13:02,311
Look at that.
Look at that.

97
00:13:03,652 --> 00:13:08,112
Here's to Devil's Night,
my new favorite holiday.

98
00:13:11,783 --> 00:13:13,782
You go over there
and talk to your pals...

99
00:13:13,822 --> 00:13:16,952
You sick fuck.

100
00:13:16,992 --> 00:13:20,712
Are you out of
your motherfucking mind, man?

101
00:13:23,963 --> 00:13:28,342
Look at that!

102
00:13:30,553 --> 00:13:32,592
Pussies drink last, man.

103
00:13:33,843 --> 00:13:36,263
- Fuck you, Tin Tin.
- Hey.

104
00:13:37,683 --> 00:13:40,182
Shit ain't
even loaded, man.

105
00:13:40,273 --> 00:13:42,443
This one is.

106
00:13:42,522 --> 00:13:45,443
Which of you Motor City
motherfuckers...

107
00:13:45,523 --> 00:13:49,823
wants to bet me
this one isn't?

108
00:13:49,903 --> 00:13:53,783
Hey, fire it up!
Fire it up!

109
00:13:53,863 --> 00:13:56,953
- Fire it up! - Fire
it up! - Fire it up!

110
00:13:57,033 --> 00:13:59,833
Fire it up! Fire it up!

111
00:13:59,913 --> 00:14:03,004
Here's your shooters.

112
00:14:03,083 --> 00:14:05,043
- Put your guns away, huh, guys?
- How ya doing?

113
00:14:05,133 --> 00:14:08,803
Pussycat.

114
00:14:28,904 --> 00:14:32,444
Boo.

115
00:14:40,455 --> 00:14:43,964
- I love you.
- Say that again.

116
00:14:44,045 --> 00:14:46,294
I love you.

117
00:14:46,374 --> 00:14:49,544
Oh, boy.

118
00:14:49,635 --> 00:14:53,054
Restaurant.

119
00:14:57,724 --> 00:15:00,894
- Wow, you look great.
- Ta-da!

120
00:15:04,065 --> 00:15:07,905
Yeah!

121
00:15:07,945 --> 00:15:10,525
- Come here!
- No, no, no!

122
00:16:48,667 --> 00:16:51,218
Couple more rings.
That's 24k.

123
00:16:51,297 --> 00:16:55,307
24k, huh? It's 18k.
It's crap. It's probably fake.

124
00:16:55,388 --> 00:16:57,717
Leather purse. Leather.

125
00:16:57,808 --> 00:17:02,307
Geez. Oh, what is this, Tin Tin?

126
00:17:02,398 --> 00:17:06,938
A blood stain
that's on here?

127
00:17:07,028 --> 00:17:09,648
I'll give you 50 bucks.
And I hate charities.

128
00:17:09,738 --> 00:17:12,568
Now, you,
take it or leave it.

129
00:17:12,658 --> 00:17:15,408
Right there for ya.

130
00:17:15,489 --> 00:17:19,868
Decisions, decisions.

131
00:17:21,408 --> 00:17:24,578
You cheap ass, chrome dome...

132
00:17:24,669 --> 00:17:27,669
... child molesting,
saprophyte motherfucker.

133
00:17:27,708 --> 00:17:30,089
Close the gate
when you go out!

134
00:17:30,168 --> 00:17:32,839
Oh, I close this up
for you real good, massa.

135
00:17:32,878 --> 00:17:35,429
Fuck you.

136
00:17:35,509 --> 00:17:38,928
Yeah, sit on it and twirl,
you dirty scum.

137
00:17:43,649 --> 00:17:48,108
Lucky I didn't stab
your fat ass.

138
00:19:33,171 --> 00:19:36,302
What the fuck you all painted
up for, crackhead, huh?

139
00:19:38,892 --> 00:19:43,142
Halloween ain't till manana.

140
00:19:46,521 --> 00:19:49,062
Come on.

141
00:20:25,142 --> 00:20:28,563
Fuck, you murderer!

142
00:20:28,643 --> 00:20:31,273
I ain't murdered nobody, man!
I don't even fucking know you!

143
00:20:31,353 --> 00:20:35,444
- Man, what the fuck you want, man?
- I want you to tell me a story.

144
00:20:35,533 --> 00:20:38,953
A man and a woman
in a loft a year ago.

145
00:20:38,993 --> 00:20:41,574
- You're out of your fucking mind...
- Listen!

146
00:20:41,663 --> 00:20:46,493
I'm sure you'll remember.
You killed them... on Halloween.

147
00:20:46,583 --> 00:20:51,543
Yeah, yeah, Halloween, yeah.
Some dude, some bitch, whatever, man.

148
00:20:51,584 --> 00:20:54,044
Her name was Shelly.

149
00:20:54,134 --> 00:20:57,133
You cut her.
You raped her.

150
00:20:57,214 --> 00:21:03,013
Shelly, yeah, yeah. I shanked
her pink ass and she loved it!

151
00:21:12,234 --> 00:21:17,154
Murderer? Murderer? Let me tell you
about murder. It's fun!

152
00:21:17,234 --> 00:21:21,864
It's easy.
You gonna learn all about it.

153
00:21:26,584 --> 00:21:29,125
I'd like you to meet
two buddies of mine.

154
00:21:29,205 --> 00:21:31,874
We never miss.

155
00:21:40,305 --> 00:21:42,385
Try harder.

156
00:21:42,475 --> 00:21:44,555
- Try again!
- Aaah!

157
00:21:49,645 --> 00:21:54,485
Victims.
Aren't we all?

158
00:22:19,216 --> 00:22:23,555
- Look at this mess! What's the world coming to?
- It's a mess.

159
00:22:30,936 --> 00:22:33,696
I got to go upstairs.
Report from the front.

160
00:22:38,447 --> 00:22:41,746
Get out of my way,
you worms!

161
00:22:42,866 --> 00:22:44,787
Give me some of that
over there!

162
00:22:47,037 --> 00:22:50,747
Why don't you ladies come by later?
Check me out.

163
00:22:50,797 --> 00:22:55,586
Hey, guess what?
Arcade Games fell down, went boom.

164
00:22:55,627 --> 00:22:59,467
- Boom.
- Can you imagine that? It's tragic.

165
00:22:59,546 --> 00:23:03,766
Gather your soldiers.
You're on for tomorrow night. No sweat.

166
00:23:03,807 --> 00:23:07,897
- Is the man in?
- He's taking a meeting.

167
00:23:37,927 --> 00:23:41,718
You're thinking
about the past.

168
00:23:44,018 --> 00:23:46,517
Dad gave me this.

169
00:23:46,598 --> 00:23:50,768
Fifth birthday.

170
00:23:50,858 --> 00:23:55,528
He said childhood's over
the moment you know you're gonna die.

171
00:24:09,418 --> 00:24:11,879
Is she asleep?

172
00:24:18,088 --> 00:24:20,339
I think we broke her.

173
00:24:24,349 --> 00:24:26,469
I love her eyes.

174
00:24:27,519 --> 00:24:29,479
Pretty.

175
00:24:46,080 --> 00:24:49,249
Hey, kid,
get the hell outta the road!

176
00:25:07,850 --> 00:25:13,400
I told you to stay out of here.

177
00:25:13,440 --> 00:25:17,110
So I guess you're not gonna be home
till a lot later, huh, Darla?

178
00:25:17,191 --> 00:25:21,241
She's busy. Go play with your dolls
or something, okay?

179
00:25:21,280 --> 00:25:23,620
I don't have any dolls.

180
00:25:23,700 --> 00:25:27,080
Get some food, huh?

181
00:25:27,121 --> 00:25:30,121
Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police.

182
00:25:35,841 --> 00:25:39,510
- "Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police. "

183
00:25:49,521 --> 00:25:52,771
Thirty, forty dollars.

184
00:25:54,521 --> 00:25:56,981
Who the fuck is this now?

185
00:25:57,021 --> 00:26:01,191
Hey! Piss off!
We're closed!

186
00:26:01,282 --> 00:26:03,951
Cerrado!

187
00:26:04,031 --> 00:26:07,872
Sleep it off somewhere else, dusthead,
unless you want to get mutilated.

188
00:26:15,462 --> 00:26:19,712
Goddamn creatures of the night,
they never learn.

189
00:26:21,422 --> 00:26:23,172
Hey! Hey!

190
00:26:27,392 --> 00:26:31,772
"Suddenly I heard
a tapping, as if someone...

191
00:26:31,812 --> 00:26:35,772
gently rapping,
rapping at my chamber door. "

192
00:26:37,733 --> 00:26:40,032
What are you talking about?

193
00:26:40,112 --> 00:26:42,822
You heard me rapping, right?

194
00:26:42,902 --> 00:26:47,033
You're trespassing,
and you owe me a fucking new door!

195
00:26:49,453 --> 00:26:52,412
I'm looking for something
in an engagement ring.

196
00:26:52,503 --> 00:26:53,873
Gold.

197
00:26:53,963 --> 00:26:56,292
You're looking for a coroner,
shit-for-brains.

198
00:27:00,553 --> 00:27:05,683
Oh, shit.
Oh, shit on me!

199
00:27:05,763 --> 00:27:08,302
Shit on me.
Shit on me!

200
00:27:14,433 --> 00:27:16,693
- Aaah!
- Mr. Gideon.

201
00:27:16,774 --> 00:27:19,023
You're not paying attention.

202
00:27:21,944 --> 00:27:24,113
No!

203
00:27:24,194 --> 00:27:29,494
I repeat, a gold
engagement ring, yes?

204
00:27:31,124 --> 00:27:34,584
It was pawned here a year ago
by a customer of yours named Tin Tin.

205
00:27:37,294 --> 00:27:40,964
He confided in me
before he ran out of breath.

206
00:27:46,264 --> 00:27:48,264
Who's this sack of shit?

207
00:27:48,343 --> 00:27:51,304
That's Tin Tin, one of
T- bird's little helpers.

208
00:27:51,393 --> 00:27:54,434
I think you can rule out
accidental death.

209
00:27:54,524 --> 00:27:57,314
Don't any of your street demons
have real grown-up names?

210
00:27:57,394 --> 00:28:01,564
This could be a turf hit, but it doesn't
look like your usual gang crap.

211
00:28:01,654 --> 00:28:06,364
Come on, Albrecht, spare me.
You're a beat cop now, so be a beat cop.

212
00:28:06,444 --> 00:28:08,364
I'm suppose to thank you
for that, right?

213
00:28:08,455 --> 00:28:12,204
Word to the wise:
Watch your fucking mouth.

214
00:28:13,415 --> 00:28:15,834
What the hell
do you call that?

215
00:28:16,875 --> 00:28:19,465
I call it blood, detective.

216
00:28:19,544 --> 00:28:23,345
I suppose you'll write it up
as graffiti.

217
00:28:23,385 --> 00:28:26,175
You can leave
my crime scene now, okay?

218
00:28:32,895 --> 00:28:35,815
- Warmer?
- What are you doing?

219
00:28:35,895 --> 00:28:38,525
- Don't you know this game?
- What game?

220
00:28:38,565 --> 00:28:41,485
Okay, the rings!
I'll tell you about the rings!

221
00:28:41,566 --> 00:28:45,945
They're in that metal box!
It's under the shelf there!

222
00:28:46,035 --> 00:28:51,535
Take the fucking rings!
Choke on them, you son of a bitch!

223
00:28:55,125 --> 00:28:57,705
- Look, it goes to the attic.
- Okay.

224
00:29:06,885 --> 00:29:08,886
No, no.

225
00:29:08,976 --> 00:29:12,096
No, no, no.

226
00:29:14,606 --> 00:29:18,816
Oh, it's beautiful.
I don't believe it.

227
00:29:22,736 --> 00:29:25,117
Shelly.

228
00:29:33,286 --> 00:29:34,667
I love you.

229
00:29:42,717 --> 00:29:45,637
- You have one chance to live.
- Take anything you want.

230
00:29:45,717 --> 00:29:48,807
- Thank you.
- Take anything!

231
00:29:48,887 --> 00:29:51,727
Now you're going to tell me
where to find...

232
00:29:51,808 --> 00:29:54,437
the rest of Tin Tin's
little party pals.

233
00:29:54,518 --> 00:29:56,897
The Pit. They all
hang out at The Pit.

234
00:29:56,977 --> 00:30:02,067
T- birds's little potato-heads hang out
there. Funboy lives there upstairs.

235
00:30:02,147 --> 00:30:05,158
- Funboy.
- Oh, baby, oh.

236
00:30:05,237 --> 00:30:08,988
- A whole jolly club...
- Please!

237
00:30:09,077 --> 00:30:11,827
- with jolly pirate nicknames!
- Stop! Please!

238
00:30:11,907 --> 00:30:14,578
- Jesus Christ in a taxicab!
- Hold still!

239
00:30:16,247 --> 00:30:19,628
Each one of these is a life...

240
00:30:19,708 --> 00:30:22,218
a life you helped destroy.

241
00:30:22,298 --> 00:30:24,928
I'm begging you.
Don't kill me.

242
00:30:24,968 --> 00:30:28,678
I'm not gonna kill you.

243
00:30:28,758 --> 00:30:32,928
Your job will be to tell the rest
of them that death is coming for them...

244
00:30:32,978 --> 00:30:36,518
tonight.

245

246

No!

287

396

Shi...

416

417

418

Give me something

419
00:46:55,853 --> 00:46:58,113
Yeah.

420

Look, I...

You think any people in that building,

427

430

431

Musicians.

445

- So far I haven't heard...

446

447

448

449

450

451

Aah! Jesus.

452

453

454
00:49:26,467 --> 00:49:30,136
All the power in the world

455
00:49:30,227 --> 00:49:34,186

456
00:49:34,266 --> 00:49:38,397
You're directly out of

457
00:49:38,486 --> 00:49:41,146
Yeah.

458

470

471

472
00:50:30,405 --> 00:50:34,915

488
00:53:01,409 --> 00:53:03,989

489
00:53:04,078 --> 00:53:06,159

00:53:06,249 --> 00:53:09,209
Tin Tin.
Sheesh.

491
00:53:09,289 --> 00:53:13,499
Fire it up! Fire it up!
Fire it up! Fire it up!

492
00:53:13,589 --> 00:53:15,499
Fire it up!

493
00:53:18,090 --> 00:53:20,179
No Funboy.

494
00:53:20,260 --> 00:53:24,179
Probably still...
banging away on Darla.

495
00:53:29,560 --> 00:53:32,649
Smokes and road beers.
Be quick.

496
00:53:32,730 --> 00:53:34,730
I'm on it.

497
00:54:05,390 --> 00:54:08,971
What the fuck are
you supposed to be, man?

498
00:54:09,061 --> 00:54:13,690
I'm your passenger.

499
00:54:20,570 --> 00:54:22,741
Drive.

500
00:54:27,831 --> 00:54:29,621
What's all this
happy horseshit?

501
00:54:29,700 --> 00:54:31,831
Hey, T-bird! T-bird!

502
00:54:37,251 --> 00:54:40,512
- Oh, shit!
- What the fuck's the matter with you?

503
00:54:40,591 --> 00:54:44,592
Stupid asshair!
You hit my car!

504
00:54:51,561 --> 00:54:55,982
What do you want, man?
Money? Drugs? I got it.

505
00:54:57,611 --> 00:55:00,482
We could use you.
You did Tin Tin.

506
00:55:00,572 --> 00:55:03,652
- This is business, right?
- Faster.

507
00:55:06,622 --> 00:55:10,832
You got that cream stuff?

508
00:55:10,872 --> 00:55:13,292
I hate this.
They can't even call it cream legally.

509
00:55:14,872 --> 00:55:17,882
What in the crap...

510
00:55:21,383 --> 00:55:24,222
Oh, look. Making us popular.

511
00:55:24,263 --> 00:55:26,973
When they flash us like that,
they ain't friends.

512
00:55:32,563 --> 00:55:35,522
This is Vehicle 48. We got us
a big, old, red hot rod.

513
00:55:38,062 --> 00:55:40,233
Turn.

514
00:55:41,573 --> 00:55:44,323
You got something personal, amigo,
we can work it out.

515
00:55:44,403 --> 00:55:48,743
Right? Huh?

516
00:55:50,283 --> 00:55:52,793
Damn! Dead end!

517
00:55:58,173 --> 00:56:00,633
Look out!

518
00:56:03,964 --> 00:56:06,184
Oh, my God!
Get outta the way!

519
00:56:17,273 --> 00:56:21,523
Holy shit! Goddamn foreign cars!

520
00:56:25,194 --> 00:56:27,704
Shit! Shit!

521
00:56:34,834 --> 00:56:38,544
Oh, I hate this.
This ain't good.

522
00:56:39,964 --> 00:56:43,424
T- bird!
I got you, man!

523
00:56:43,504 --> 00:56:45,885
Shit!

524
00:56:59,275 --> 00:57:01,564
Remember?
Yeah, I remember everything.

525
00:57:01,655 --> 00:57:04,904
But I don't know what...
What? Huh? What?

526
00:57:04,945 --> 00:57:07,745
What are you talking about?
No, no, no, no, no.

527
00:57:07,785 --> 00:57:10,915
You mean that place downtown?
Yeah, I remember her.

528
00:57:10,955 --> 00:57:13,125
We needed to put some fear
into that little lady.

529
00:57:13,206 --> 00:57:16,455
She wasn't going along
with our tenant relocation program.

530
00:57:16,545 --> 00:57:20,125
And her idiot boyfriend shows up
and turns a simple sweep-and-clear...

531
00:57:20,215 --> 00:57:23,635
into a total cluster fuck!
Who gives a shit?

532
00:57:23,715 --> 00:57:26,966
It's ancient history!
Why? What do you want?

533
00:57:27,055 --> 00:57:31,976
What is it? What?
Speak to me. Speak!

534
00:57:33,556 --> 00:57:35,436
Did you send us
these complaints?

535
00:57:37,146 --> 00:57:40,486
Come here!
"Abashed the devil stood. "

536
00:57:40,525 --> 00:57:42,906
Does it get you sweaty?

537
00:57:42,986 --> 00:57:48,196
I know you. I know you.
I knew I knew you.

538
00:57:48,246 --> 00:57:52,326
I knew I knew you.
But you ain't you.

539
00:57:52,496 --> 00:57:56,417
You can't be you. We put you through
the window. There ain't no coming back.

540
00:57:56,496 --> 00:57:59,966
This is the really real world.
There ain't no coming back.

541
00:58:00,007 --> 00:58:02,377
We killed you dead.
There ain't no coming back.

542
00:58:02,466 --> 00:58:06,926
T- bird...

543
00:58:07,007 --> 00:58:09,976
There ain't no coming back!
There ain't no coming back!

544
00:58:12,516 --> 00:58:16,686
T- bird.

545
00:58:16,767 --> 00:58:20,147
"Abashed the devil stood...

546
00:58:20,187 --> 00:58:23,156
and felt how awful goodness is. "

547
00:58:23,237 --> 00:58:26,117
"And felt how awful goodness is. "

548
00:58:40,168 --> 00:58:42,758
T- bird. T-bird.

549
00:59:33,139 --> 00:59:35,439
This is the 7:00 a. m. edition
of Action News.

550
00:59:35,519 --> 00:59:37,859
For over a decade,
the night before Halloween...

551
00:59:37,899 --> 00:59:42,279
has had a darker and deadlier nickname
in the inner city, "Devil's Night"...

552
00:59:42,358 --> 00:59:45,779
the name given to what has become
an annual plague of arson.

553
00:59:45,859 --> 00:59:51,239
Last year over 200 blazes were reported,
and 11 people lost their lives.

554
00:59:51,289 --> 00:59:56,459
Tonight may become the biggest
and deadliest Devil's Night ever.

555
00:59:56,540 --> 01:00:00,169
The mayor has fire fighters
from all surrounding counties...

556
01:00:00,250 --> 01:00:04,049
Do you like them up or over?
I can't remember.

557
01:00:06,089 --> 01:00:08,799
What are you doing?
I don't even like eggs.

558
01:00:08,890 --> 01:00:13,809
- Wait, you loved eggs.
- Yeah, when I was five.

559
01:00:13,890 --> 01:00:18,020
So what do you want now?
Black coffee and cigarettes?

560
01:00:18,099 --> 01:00:21,440
So what did you take
to become mother of the year?

561
01:00:21,480 --> 01:00:26,610
Oh, it wasn't drugs.
Someone kind of woke me up.

562
01:00:26,650 --> 01:00:32,450
- Who?
- Oh, it was nuts.

563
01:00:32,490 --> 01:00:37,751
You're acting weird. Did you win
the lottery or something, Darla?

564
01:00:40,250 --> 01:00:44,550
Oh, forget it. I never was
too good at this mommy shit.

565
01:00:44,631 --> 01:00:46,840
Over easy.

566
01:00:48,931 --> 01:00:53,641
I like 'em
over easy... Mom.

567
01:01:04,231 --> 01:01:06,491
Hey, Albrecht.

568
01:01:09,241 --> 01:01:12,161
This is the third hit
in your hood in 24 hours.

569
01:01:12,241 --> 01:01:15,491
We just fished this out of the river.
He's fused to his own car.

570
01:01:15,581 --> 01:01:19,792
- We're gonna have to I. D. his teeth.
- His name is T-bird.

571
01:01:19,871 --> 01:01:21,792
Arson was his specialty.

572
01:01:21,881 --> 01:01:23,842
Looks like he zigged
when he should have zagged.

573
01:01:23,921 --> 01:01:27,842
- Case closed.
- Bull-fuckin'- shit.

574
01:01:27,922 --> 01:01:30,181
Come here.

575
01:01:33,931 --> 01:01:35,891
You're holding out on me.

576
01:01:35,972 --> 01:01:39,521
I got a goddamn vigilante killer
knocking off scumbags left and right...

577
01:01:39,602 --> 01:01:42,862
and you're covering up
for somebody.

578
01:01:42,941 --> 01:01:45,362
Who's the cartoon character
in the painted face?

579
01:01:45,442 --> 01:01:49,322
- You're the detective. You tell me.
- Okay.

580
01:01:49,402 --> 01:01:51,533
Gideon's blows all to hell and you're
having a chitchat with some weirdo...

581
01:01:51,612 --> 01:01:54,492
who winds up in T-bird's car
when it zigs instead of zags.

582
01:01:54,532 --> 01:01:57,492
Then you steal one of
my case files from homicide...

583
01:01:57,582 --> 01:01:59,502
and you're saying this is
just a fucking automobile accident?

584
01:01:59,582 --> 01:02:01,872
- Come on!
- Yeah. Good speech though.

585
01:02:01,962 --> 01:02:03,962
I didn't want to interrupt you.
It sounded good.

586
01:02:04,042 --> 01:02:06,042
You gotta write that shit down.

587
01:02:06,092 --> 01:02:08,053
All right, smart-ass.

588
01:02:08,092 --> 01:02:11,183
The captain's got a little
love note waiting for you.

589
01:02:11,223 --> 01:02:15,183
- Welcome to the first day of the rest of your suspension.
- Suspension?

590
01:02:15,222 --> 01:02:18,973
- For what?
- Misconduct.

591
01:02:19,063 --> 01:02:23,063
Yeah, give me the lab.

592
01:03:13,824 --> 01:03:16,414
One for sorrow,
two for joy...

593
01:03:16,495 --> 01:03:19,334
- Come here.
- ... three for a girl, four for a boy.

594
01:03:24,375 --> 01:03:28,174
Dancing...

595
01:03:59,285 --> 01:04:01,246
Eric?

596
01:04:03,956 --> 01:04:08,255
Man, Sarah,
you're going crazy.

597
01:04:08,296 --> 01:04:11,256
Gabriel.

598
01:04:11,306 --> 01:04:14,095
I thought you were dead.

599
01:04:14,136 --> 01:04:17,435
You're not dead, are you?

600
01:04:42,206 --> 01:04:45,126
I knew it was you.

601
01:04:47,047 --> 01:04:49,966
Even with the makeup.

602
01:04:54,807 --> 01:04:57,387
I remembered your song.

603
01:04:57,476 --> 01:05:01,227
You said,
"Can't rain all the time. "

604
01:05:01,307 --> 01:05:04,567
That is from your song, right?

605
01:05:14,487 --> 01:05:17,617
Come on, Eric. I know you're here.

606
01:05:19,997 --> 01:05:24,087
I miss you...
and Shelly.

607
01:05:27,167 --> 01:05:30,628
Get so lonely
all by myself.

608
01:05:32,467 --> 01:05:37,098
The hell with you.
I thought you cared.

609
01:05:37,177 --> 01:05:40,308
Sarah, I do care.

610
01:05:51,529 --> 01:05:53,658
That's him.
That's him!

611
01:05:53,738 --> 01:05:57,078
But he looked different. He was painted
up white like some kind of dead whore.

612
01:05:57,158 --> 01:06:00,408
I seen him. T-bird sent me in
for some road beers, right?

613
01:06:00,498 --> 01:06:03,038
Then he took him away.
But I chased him down.

614
01:06:03,128 --> 01:06:05,918
And he flash fried T-bird
to his fucking car!

615
01:06:05,999 --> 01:06:09,508
Aw, T-bird!
Here's to you, buddy.

616
01:06:09,589 --> 01:06:13,508
Maybe we oughta just videotape this.
Play it back in slow motion.

617
01:06:14,848 --> 01:06:19,429
- Fire it up! Fire it up!
- You see the grave?

618
01:06:19,519 --> 01:06:22,098
- Empty.
- Fire it...

619
01:06:22,189 --> 01:06:24,098
Grave?
What grave?

620
01:06:24,189 --> 01:06:26,399
What about
my fucking grave?

621
01:06:26,479 --> 01:06:27,819
Three out of four.

622
01:06:27,899 --> 01:06:31,149
He's working his way back
to this speed freak right here.

623
01:06:31,239 --> 01:06:33,859
It's not fair.
It's Funboy's fault.

624
01:06:33,949 --> 01:06:37,119
That boy was out of control.
T- bird, he came in, he says...

625
01:06:37,199 --> 01:06:40,500
... "Waste them both. " And now
this ghost gonna kill my ass next!

626
01:06:44,539 --> 01:06:47,630
This ghost gonna
kill my ass next.

627
01:06:47,709 --> 01:06:51,469
- This ghost gonna kill...
- Hey.

628
01:06:51,549 --> 01:06:53,510
That ain't no ghost.

629
01:06:55,429 --> 01:06:58,599
- They have all arrived.
- Watch him.

630
01:06:58,640 --> 01:07:00,640
We might need him.

631
01:07:02,139 --> 01:07:04,600
Ghost gonna kill my...

632
01:07:17,321 --> 01:07:21,290
He like his plain
or with onions?

633
01:07:21,330 --> 01:07:24,791
Fine.
Don't talk to me.

634
01:07:24,830 --> 01:07:28,961
When someone's dead,
they can't come back, can they?

635
01:07:29,000 --> 01:07:31,630
That's what I thought.

636
01:07:31,671 --> 01:07:34,470
Are you referring
to anyone in particular?

637
01:07:34,510 --> 01:07:36,801
You'll just think
I'm nuts.

638
01:07:36,841 --> 01:07:40,470
Yeah, well, then maybe
they'll have to lock us both up.

639
01:07:40,561 --> 01:07:45,891
- You see him too?
- I saw somebody.

640
01:07:45,981 --> 01:07:49,481
Maybe it was
your fairy godfather.

641
01:07:49,571 --> 01:07:52,481
Eric didn't come back for me.

642
01:07:52,571 --> 01:07:57,321
He can't be my friend anymore
because I'm alive.

643
01:07:57,411 --> 01:08:00,582
You want a friend
to walk you home?

644
01:09:34,714 --> 01:09:37,633
Boys.

645
01:09:37,713 --> 01:09:41,134
It seems our friend T-bird won't be
joining us this evening...

646
01:09:41,223 --> 01:09:43,304
on account of
a slight case of death.

647
01:09:43,394 --> 01:09:45,354
You wanna sit down?

648
01:09:45,434 --> 01:09:50,814
Well, well, well.

649
01:09:50,854 --> 01:09:53,944
Devil's Night is
upon us again.

650
01:09:53,984 --> 01:09:55,945
I thought we'd throw
a little party...

651
01:09:55,984 --> 01:09:59,285
start a bunch of fires,
make a little profit.

652
01:09:59,324 --> 01:10:01,574
I like the pretty lights.

653
01:10:04,585 --> 01:10:08,504
Problem is, it's all been done before.
You see what I'm saying?

654
01:10:08,544 --> 01:10:13,755
- That's no reason to quit.
- Wrong. Best reason to quit.

655
01:10:13,835 --> 01:10:16,214
Only reason to quit.

656
01:10:16,305 --> 01:10:21,805
A man has an idea.

657
01:10:21,885 --> 01:10:24,144
The idea attracts others...

658
01:10:24,225 --> 01:10:26,315
like-minded.

659
01:10:26,395 --> 01:10:28,475
The idea expands.

660
01:10:28,565 --> 01:10:32,195
The idea becomes
an institution.

661
01:10:32,275 --> 01:10:34,945
What was the idea?

662
01:10:35,025 --> 01:10:38,785
See, that's what's
been bothering me, boys.

663
01:10:38,866 --> 01:10:41,655
But I'll tell ya, when I used
to think about the idea itself...

664
01:10:41,746 --> 01:10:44,825
it'd put a big old smile on my face.

665
01:10:44,916 --> 01:10:47,086
You see, gentlemen...

666
01:10:47,166 --> 01:10:52,166
greed is for amateurs.

667
01:10:52,256 --> 01:10:57,425
Disorder, chaos, anarchy...

668
01:10:57,506 --> 01:11:00,096
now that's fun!

669
01:11:00,176 --> 01:11:02,475
- What about Devil's Night?
- What about it?

670
01:11:02,556 --> 01:11:05,976
I started the first fires
in this goddamn city.

671
01:11:06,015 --> 01:11:09,106
Before I knew it, every charlatan
and shitheel was imitating me.

672
01:11:09,186 --> 01:11:12,646
Do you know
what they got now?

673
01:11:12,686 --> 01:11:16,986
Devil's Night greeting cards.

674
01:11:17,026 --> 01:11:19,986
Isn't that precious?

675
01:11:20,036 --> 01:11:22,156
Yeah.

676
01:11:22,197 --> 01:11:26,996
The idea has become
the institution, boys.

677
01:11:27,036 --> 01:11:29,086
Time to move along.

678
01:11:29,166 --> 01:11:31,586
You don't want us to do
"Light My Fire" time for the whole city?

679
01:11:31,667 --> 01:11:34,166
No.

680
01:11:34,216 --> 01:11:36,837
No, I want you to set
a fire so goddamn big...

681
01:11:36,887 --> 01:11:40,007
the gods will notice us again.
That's what I'm saying.

682
01:11:40,057 --> 01:11:42,677
I want all of you boys to be able
to look me straight in the eye...

683
01:11:42,717 --> 01:11:47,187
one more time and say,
"Are we having fun or what?"

684
01:11:47,226 --> 01:11:49,357
- Hey, you! What's your name?
- Huh?

685
01:11:49,397 --> 01:11:51,357
Skank!
You don't feel that?

686
01:11:51,397 --> 01:11:54,737
- I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook.

687
01:11:54,777 --> 01:11:57,197
"I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook. "

688
01:11:57,277 --> 01:12:01,657
Well, boy, your mama
must be damn proud of you!

689
01:12:04,118 --> 01:12:06,747
How the hell did
that thing get in here?

690
01:12:08,168 --> 01:12:10,667
Gentlemen.

691
01:12:10,747 --> 01:12:15,377
Let me go!
Let me go! I gotta go!

692
01:12:19,928 --> 01:12:23,718
You're him, huh?
The avenger.

693
01:12:23,768 --> 01:12:26,268
The killer of killers.

694
01:12:26,348 --> 01:12:29,188
Nice outfit.

695
01:12:29,268 --> 01:12:31,319
I'm not sure
about the face though.

696
01:12:31,398 --> 01:12:33,438
I just want him.

697
01:12:33,528 --> 01:12:36,948
Well, you can't have him.

698
01:12:37,029 --> 01:12:39,698
Well...

699
01:12:41,778 --> 01:12:44,238
I see you have
made your decision.

700
01:12:45,828 --> 01:12:47,789
Now let's see you enforce it.

701
01:12:47,869 --> 01:12:51,538
Aw, this is already boring the shit
out of me. Kill him!

702
01:12:57,418 --> 01:13:01,349
Ooh, that had to hurt.

703
01:13:01,429 --> 01:13:04,219
Well, that's that.

704
01:13:04,309 --> 01:13:07,478
That guy was crazy.

705
01:13:14,109 --> 01:13:15,900
He's gone.

706
01:13:23,950 --> 01:13:25,660
Get him!

707
01:13:42,929 --> 01:13:45,720
Right here! Here, help me!
He's gonna kill me!

708
01:13:49,770 --> 01:13:51,770
Jesus Christ!

709
01:14:08,200 --> 01:14:10,160
Hey!

710
01:14:42,701 --> 01:14:45,032
You're all going to die.

711
01:15:00,052 --> 01:15:02,882
Get the fuck outta here!

712
01:15:38,673 --> 01:15:41,593
Guess it's not a good day
to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?

713
01:15:41,673 --> 01:15:44,883
I'm not Skank.
There's Skank right there.

714
01:15:44,973 --> 01:15:48,853
- Skank's dead.
- That's right.

715
01:15:48,933 --> 01:15:50,723
No!

716
01:15:55,353 --> 01:15:59,023
What in the crap...

717
01:16:00,363 --> 01:16:02,994
- Don't move!
- Hold it!

718
01:16:03,073 --> 01:16:06,493
That's all she wrote!
Move and we shoot!

719
01:16:15,584 --> 01:16:18,464
You are surrounded by police units.
Do not attempt to escape.

720
01:16:21,924 --> 01:16:25,553
- Stop running immediately.
- Holy shit!

721
01:16:25,634 --> 01:16:27,764
... arms and legs...

722
01:16:33,314 --> 01:16:38,104
Stop immediately.
Lie down, spread your arms and legs...

723
01:17:18,735 --> 01:17:23,366
Come on! Move it!

724
01:17:27,786 --> 01:17:30,915
My advice:
Next time duck.

725
01:17:32,956 --> 01:17:35,335
So many cops, you'd think
they were giving away donuts.

726
01:17:38,796 --> 01:17:41,925
Shit!

727
01:17:44,805 --> 01:17:47,716
Oh. I knew you
were gonna do that.

728
01:17:47,806 --> 01:17:50,266
Look at that out there.

729
01:17:50,306 --> 01:17:53,266
The whole city oughta be
in flames by now.

730
01:17:53,306 --> 01:17:56,526
Sky oughta be red.

731
01:17:56,606 --> 01:18:00,946
So that, I take it,
is the late, great Eric Draven.

732
01:18:00,987 --> 01:18:06,697
He has power, but it is power
you can take from him.

733
01:18:06,786 --> 01:18:09,747
- I like him already.
- The crow...

734
01:18:09,827 --> 01:18:14,287
is his link between
the land of the living...

735
01:18:14,376 --> 01:18:16,707
and the realm of the dead.

736
01:18:16,797 --> 01:18:21,337
So, kill the crow
and destroy the man.

737
01:18:46,487 --> 01:18:48,487
I'm coming home, Shelly.

738
01:19:37,578 --> 01:19:40,049
You're gonna say
I shouldn't be in the cemetery...

739
01:19:40,089 --> 01:19:42,168
in the middle
of the night, right?

740
01:19:42,209 --> 01:19:44,009
Safest place in the world to be.

741
01:19:44,049 --> 01:19:48,849
It's 'cause everybody's dead.
I knew you'd come here.

742
01:19:48,889 --> 01:19:53,059
It's really late, Sarah.

743
01:19:53,139 --> 01:19:55,889
You didn't say good-bye.

744
01:19:56,019 --> 01:19:59,979
You're just gonna have
to forgive me for that.

745
01:20:00,069 --> 01:20:04,319
And you're never coming back.

746
01:20:10,620 --> 01:20:13,870
I gave this to Shelly once.

747
01:20:17,580 --> 01:20:20,540
I think she'd like you
to have it.

748
01:20:24,590 --> 01:20:26,880
This way you'll
always remember her.

749
01:20:26,930 --> 01:20:29,510
I'll never take it off.

750
01:20:47,650 --> 01:20:51,491
I better go sneak
back in the house.

751
01:20:57,621 --> 01:20:59,581
Bye.

752
01:21:19,561 --> 01:21:22,401
Shh! Shh!

753
01:21:24,321 --> 01:21:26,741
Shh. Take it easy, sweetheart.

754
01:21:33,662 --> 01:21:36,122
Come on.
Come on.

755
01:21:49,422 --> 01:21:53,552
What is that? Some sort of souvenir
there from your pal?

756
01:21:55,142 --> 01:21:58,273
I'll just keep it for good luck.
What do you say, hmm?

757
01:22:04,693 --> 01:22:07,993
Her eyes are so innocent.

758
01:22:19,333 --> 01:22:21,293
Eric!

759
01:22:21,333 --> 01:22:25,293
Eric, help! Eric!

760
01:23:04,754 --> 01:23:07,964
Quick impression for ya.

761
01:23:08,054 --> 01:23:11,765
Caw! Caw! Bang!
Fuck, I'm dead!

762
01:23:11,844 --> 01:23:15,184
Give me the girl
and I'll let you walk out of here.

763
01:23:15,264 --> 01:23:18,314
Well, well.

764
01:23:18,394 --> 01:23:22,144
Why don't you just give me a minute
to think about that, huh?

765
01:23:30,115 --> 01:23:32,404
Nah. Fuck it.

766
01:23:40,875 --> 01:23:43,005
Aw, fuck.

767
01:23:50,255 --> 01:23:54,806
Well, well, well. It does seem to me
that our little life has undergone...

768
01:23:54,885 --> 01:23:58,725
a rather significant change in the past
few minutes now. Wouldn't you agree?

769
01:24:03,065 --> 01:24:06,446
Well, for a ghost,
you bleed just fine.

770
01:24:09,986 --> 01:24:12,236
- It's still alive.
- Well, then kill it!

771
01:24:13,905 --> 01:24:16,116
Bye-bye, birdie.

772
01:25:01,207 --> 01:25:03,337
Ah, shit.

773
01:25:03,377 --> 01:25:05,507
Well, just came by
to pay my respects...

774
01:25:05,547 --> 01:25:07,587
and here you are
getting all shot up again.

775
01:25:07,667 --> 01:25:10,257
- They've taken Sarah.
- How many?

776
01:25:10,337 --> 01:25:12,348
Two more.

777
01:25:12,387 --> 01:25:14,387
I can handle it.
Don't worry.

778
01:25:14,467 --> 01:25:17,017
I'm not worried.
Look, here's the plan.

779
01:25:17,058 --> 01:25:19,847
You stay in front, and when they
run out of ammo, I'll arrest 'em.

780
01:25:19,897 --> 01:25:23,648
That sounds like a great plan.
There's just one problem.

781
01:25:26,277 --> 01:25:29,818
Oh, shit.
You're bleeding all over the place.

782
01:25:29,907 --> 01:25:31,948
I thought, you know,
you were invincible.

783
01:25:32,027 --> 01:25:35,488
I was.
I'm not anymore.

784
01:25:35,578 --> 01:25:39,788
Well, I guess you really will
need my help, won't you?

785
01:25:39,867 --> 01:25:42,788
Come on.

786
01:25:45,458 --> 01:25:47,508
You take that.

787
01:26:17,579 --> 01:26:21,039
- You were supposed to stay behind me.
- I think I messed up.

788
01:26:45,149 --> 01:26:48,399
This is all the power
you ever had.

789
01:26:48,440 --> 01:26:50,569
Now it is mine.

790
01:26:50,610 --> 01:26:54,320
Pity there's not more time...

791
01:26:54,409 --> 01:26:57,030
... for us.

792
01:27:15,180 --> 01:27:18,011
Help, Eric!
I'm scared!

793
01:27:20,140 --> 01:27:22,680
Let me go!

794
01:27:31,781 --> 01:27:35,321
Let her go!

795
01:27:35,361 --> 01:27:38,280
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

796
01:27:38,280 --> 01:27:39,991
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

797
01:27:40,041 --> 01:27:42,041
All right.

798
01:27:42,121 --> 01:27:44,160
No!

799
01:28:30,592 --> 01:28:32,052
Eric!

800
01:28:50,653 --> 01:28:53,983
- Sarah?
- Look out!

801
01:28:57,573 --> 01:29:01,073
Eric!

802
01:29:09,083 --> 01:29:11,253
You know,
my daddy used to say...

803
01:29:11,344 --> 01:29:13,843
"Every man's got a devil...

804
01:29:13,923 --> 01:29:16,054
and you can't rest
till you find him. "

805
01:29:16,133 --> 01:29:18,683
What happened back there
with you and your girlfriend...

806
01:29:18,764 --> 01:29:21,683
I cleared that building.

807
01:29:21,764 --> 01:29:25,023
Hell, nothing in this town
happens without my say-so.

808
01:29:25,103 --> 01:29:27,944
So I'm sorry if I spoiled
your wedding plans, friend.

809
01:29:28,023 --> 01:29:30,853
But if it's any consolation
to you...

810
01:29:30,944 --> 01:29:34,574
you have put
a smile on my face.

811
01:29:34,654 --> 01:29:37,284
You got a lot
of spirit, son.

812
01:29:37,323 --> 01:29:39,954
I am going to miss you.

813
01:29:39,994 --> 01:29:42,534
I have something
to give you.

814
01:29:42,624 --> 01:29:44,994
I don't want it anymore.

815
01:29:49,505 --> 01:29:52,504
Thirty hours of pain!

816
01:29:54,844 --> 01:29:57,554
All at once!

817
01:29:57,635 --> 01:30:00,635
All for you.

818
01:30:26,245 --> 01:30:29,415
Yeah.

819
01:30:36,256 --> 01:30:39,095
Go help him.

820
01:30:42,436 --> 01:30:44,726
Are you alive?

821
01:30:46,726 --> 01:30:50,736
God, I need a cigarette.

822
01:30:56,695 --> 01:30:58,656
Everybody else dead?

823
01:30:58,695 --> 01:31:00,996
You helped me.

824
01:31:01,076 --> 01:31:03,616
What you kept in here
saved me.

825
01:31:03,706 --> 01:31:06,836
- Thanks.
- Don't mention it.

826
01:31:06,916 --> 01:31:09,916
I've been meaning
to come to church anyway.

827
01:31:14,926 --> 01:31:17,676
Oh, yuck.

828
01:31:17,756 --> 01:31:22,767
I'm quitting as of now...
if I live.

829
01:31:31,237 --> 01:31:34,697
Stay with him
until help comes.

830
01:31:34,736 --> 01:31:38,197
He'll be okay, right?

831
01:31:38,276 --> 01:31:40,487
Eric?

832
01:31:41,947 --> 01:31:45,537
He does that a lot.

833
01:32:01,808 --> 01:32:04,268
Shelly.

834
01:32:16,487 --> 01:32:21,328
- All right, what's going on in there?
- Multiple homicides.

835
01:32:21,408 --> 01:32:24,118
At least it stopped raining, huh?

836
01:32:24,158 --> 01:32:27,578
- It can't rain all the time.
- No, I don't believe it.

837
01:32:27,668 --> 01:32:30,998
- This nightmare your fault, Albrecht?
- Look, you go on home.

838
01:32:31,038 --> 01:32:33,009
- I'm okay.
- Okay.

839
01:32:33,048 --> 01:32:37,628
- Want to tell me what's going on?
- Your vigilante's up on the roof.

840
01:32:37,719 --> 01:32:39,758
You missed it.

841
01:32:39,848 --> 01:32:42,508
Get him outta here!

842
01:33:46,700 --> 01:33:48,660
Thanks.

843
01:33:53,880 --> 01:33:56,921
If the people we love
are stolen from us...

844
01:33:57,010 --> 01:34:02,091
the way to have them live on
is to never stop loving them.

845
01:34:02,180 --> 01:34:08,060
Buildings burn, people die,
but real love is forever.
